summary: This is an email chain from December 2020 between an Assistant U.S. Attorney and law enforcement personnel (NYPD/FBI) regarding outstanding investigative items for the Ghislaine Maxwell case. It discusses the status of FBI 302 reports, interview notes, forensic video file recovery, and arranging a call with a witness.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the investigation, referred to as 'Maxwell' in the context of outstanding items for her case.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned in the context of searches conducted on his devices which yielded highly confidential items.

connections.description: Maxwell's case is being investigated, with items from searches of Epstein's devices being relevant, indicating their alleged association in criminal activity.
Both are part of the law enforcement task force (NYPD/FBI) collaborating on the Maxwell/Epstein investigation, as shown in email correspondence.

events.title: Indirect Contact with Witness
events.description: Law enforcement made indirect contact with a witness who is aware she needs to be spoken to about the case going to trial. She agreed to call after the new year.

events.title: Status Update on Investigative Items
events.description: An email update was provided on the status of FBI 302s, interview notes, and forensic video file recovery from materials related to the case.

keyFacts: Searches of Jeffrey Epstein's devices had identified a number of 'highly confidential items' (images/videos), the storage location of which was being documented in an FBI 302.
FBI CART (Computer Analysis and Response Team) was attempting to recover video files from case materials, with completion expected in the new year.
Law enforcement made indirect contact with a key witness who agreed to schedule a call after the new year regarding the upcoming trial.
Outstanding FBI 302 reports and interview notes from July 2020 onward were still being processed as of late December 2020.
